Generation V.Black: It leads a group of Pawniard . It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
Generation V.White: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard . Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
Generation V.Black 2: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
Generation V.White 2: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.

Generation VI.X: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
Generation VI.Y: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard . Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard . Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it's said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It leads a group of Pawniard . Bisharp doesn't even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.

Generation VIII.Sword: It's accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard . Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
Generation VIII.Shield: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.

Generation IX.Scarlet: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard . Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
Generation IX.Violet: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
